The big Question Answered:
People keep comparing Vacation Simulator to Job Simulator but there's really no comparison other than graphically. One is a puzzle-quest game and the other is truly a job simulator. So if you like puzzles and questing you'll probably like vacation sim but if you like a funny parody of work get the job sim. I liked both and both are great!

The Game:
Vacation Simulator has 2 pretty hard puzzle games. (Sand Castle building and Ice Castle building) and they get more difficult in stages and there are 5 stages (basic, beginner, intermediate, advanced and master) There are between 2 and 5 puzzles per stage and you can beat the game without completing the master and advanced stages. You can always complete them later though if you want the achievement.

Replay value:
After I beat the game I thought I'd never play it again but I was wrong. After a few weeks away from the game I missed it and decided to try to speed run it and it was fun! The puzzles were also way easier the 2nd time!

Graphics:
I used to be paid professionally to do graphics so
my only critique is I felt like the game textures could have had a little more depth to them like you might see in World of Warcraft. Also, maybe slightly more dramatic lighting. I liked how in the Vacation Forest they made it night time for the 'scary stories'. That was cool.

So definitely get this because it's a lot of fun and totally addicting! It also does a great job of creating the total vacation vibe and who doesn't want that, especially now!
